title: The cost price of 12 mangoes is equal to the sell price of 16 mangoes. What is the loss percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price of 12 mangoes are x Then the selling price of 16 mangoes will also be x Now take the LCM of 12 and 16, which will come 48. Now find out the CP of 48 mangoes= 4x SP of 48 mangoes=3x Loss=4x-3x=x Loss%= (Loss×100)/CP = (x×100)/4x = 25% Hence the answer will be loss of 25%.

CP of 12 mangoes = N CP of one Mango = N/12 SP of 16 Mangoes = M SP of one Mango = M/16 Loss = CP - SP = (N/12 - M/16) As per question N = M Loss percentage = (CP - SP)/CP ×100 =N(1/12 - 1/16)/N/12 ×100 Loss percentage = N(1/48)×12/N ×100 = 25%
